text: Hearing feedback on this game's slightly disappointing sales directly from Zeboyd Games, it's really quite unfortunate. I've been supporting them since my very first Breath of Death VII upload and I would hate to see them become discouraged and stop making retro RPGs. CSH was far from perfect, but it brought an amazing setting and a unique battle system that pulled the game away from the mediocre story and unmemorable characters. Of course, the soundtrack was a big positive as well. This track is easily one of my favorites, I especially love the calm intro. The great buildup and afterwards also somehow gives me vibes of Starcraft with its drums and instrumentation.
author: SupraDarky

text: This is giving me MAD Terran theme vibes from Starcraft 1, which is great! That‚Äôs very unfortunate for them though. I‚Äôll still pick it up on Switch, but I am sad that it did not do well. I hope they bounce back. I really did not hear any marketing about this game past the Sony release earlier last year. I actually got a chance to speak with The Messenger Creative Director and Executive Producer and they said how lucky they were to be promoted by Nintendo and how hard it is to crack into the industry. It really is scary, especially for indies where the competition is very high.
author: GamingNobility

text: it was a phantasy star 4 ripoff from character names (Alys/Chaz, Alyssa/Chana) and that lack of a cutscene with the beast being destroyed and being all text was a dealbreaker, when they had a cutscene with some guy showing off his sunglasses.  Only worse kickstarter for me was mighty no 9.
author: Mr. Variant

text: Shame it didn't sell great, as you say it was enjoyable, not perfect but it was still a good wee game. I had issues with it but they were issues I felt if they done a sequel or anything, it would be easily rectified.

Gonna have to buy this during a discount sale later. I highly enjoyed Cthulhu Saves the World (even though I accidentally saved over a save file with another because it didn't support separate save slots for the different scenarios).
author: Trapster2

text:
Bought this game and the soundtrack on release and liked it quite a lot.
I hope Zeboyd Games will continue creating gems like this despite the low sales if possible.
author: Dekuwarrior

text: Music build up is spot on!
author: Ahmed360

text: Ohh how have I miss you SupraDarky. Always great music. Also loved this title, plat on ps4 ;)
author: Crimson Fox

text: I concur with most opinions here; love the battle system and mechanics that allow for unique long-term strategy over the course of entire encounters, and of course the stellar soundtrack and settings too. I felt it honestly had too many playable characters though.
author: Obi-Wan Kenobi

text: I really enjoyed this game for the soundtrack and battle system. The setting was pretty cool, but the characters were meh, and same with the story.
author: Redmage1000

text: Which is disappointing since Boyd is good at characters and story.
author: Freddy Martinez

text: Not an RPG person, but the battle system and lack of grinding sounded interesting. I ultimately didn't buy it, but it seemed interesting.
author: Daytime Sky

text: I'm playing this game right now, thanks to Origin putting it on vault and I'm actually loving it! Love the battle system and overall setting, the soundtrack and everything. The story is OK, but the fast pace is positive for sure. I hope they keep doing those RPGs because, at least for me, CSH is a hit in the right direction.
author: Caio L.
